Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1BW (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; BBL)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (87.5%) toBrevinin-1EMbL: 21%, F=A: 13%. GRAVY: 1.191; mol wt: 2610.268; mol formula: C124H201N29O28S2; mol ex coeff: 125.Chemical modification:  C-terminus contains a Rana box: one disulfide bond.Activity: active against Gram+ E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 3.125 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or MDR ATCC 29213 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), S. saprophytics ATCCBAA750 (MIC 6.25 ug/mL), S. epidermidis CI 1607BL1D39 (MIC 12.5 uM),  S. haemolyticus CI 1607BLD590 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 100 ug/ml), E. hormaechei ATCC700323 (MIC 100 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 100 ug/ml), K.pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC >100 ug/ml), C. koseri CI 1611SED223 (MIC 50 ug/ml). Thus, mainly Gram+.  It also had an effect on biofilms:bacteria:S. aureus.Binds LPS and anti-inflammatary: TNF-alpha, IL-1bta,a nd IL-6 reduced due to peptide treatment at 4 ug/ml.Antimicrobial robustness: heat-stable: MIC didn't change after 1 h incubation at -20oC to 100oC.MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: MOA:bacteria:E. faecalis: membrane permeabilization and damage.Toxicity: sheep RBC: HC50 35.8 ug/ml. Also toxic to multiple non-cancer cells (IC50 28.34-43.62 ug/ml) and multiple cancer cells (IC50 23.79-39.2 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Chen Z, Wang L, He D, Liu Q, Han Q, Zhang J, Zhang AM, Song Y. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Exploration of the Antibacterial and Anti-Inflammatory Activity of a Novel Antimicrobial Peptide Brevinin-1BW.
